articles.title: Will Agentic AI Be Able to Power Salesforce's Stock Higher in 2025?
articles.author: Geoffrey Seiler
articles.summary: Salesforce turned in solid results for its fiscal 2025 fourth quarter and issued conservative guidance as it looks toward agentic artificial intelligence (AI) to be its next big growth driver. Salesforce stock is down about 10% in 2025 as of this writing and nearly flat over the past 12 months. The company's revenue increased by 8% year over year to $10 billion, which was right at the midpoint of its guidance range. Subscription and support revenue rose by 8%. Mulesoft revenue jumped 7%, while Slack revenue climbed by 11%. Tableau revenue edged up by 3%.

articles.title: Boise State Offers Free Course to Help Senior Citizens Navigate AI
articles.author: Boise State News
articles.summary: The AI Tools for Seniors course is now available for free to senior citizens worldwide. It covers how AI tools can provide companionship, cognitive stimulation and assistance with daily tasks. It also includes a section on online safety and privacy to ensure participants can confidently navigate AI tools while protecting their personal information.

articles.title: AI will never become a conscious being — Sentient founder
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence will have major social implications but will not evolve to the point of being a true silicate-based life form, according to the author. He believes it won't evolve to be more than a silicate life form in the near future.

articles.title: Are your female employees dubious of AI?
articles.author: The Washington Times
articles.summary: As Artificial Intelligence proliferates, women are less inclined to use it than men, according to a recent study.      .   i.e. they are less likely to use the technology than men. i.y. .

articles.title: Pastor Has One Word to Describe Sermons Written with AI: 'Wicked'
articles.author: Ben Zeisloft
articles.summary: Pastor John Piper has a strong reaction to the idea of using chatbots to write sermons. He is appalled by the idea that a pastor could use AI to write his sermons, even if he double-checks for theological accuracy after the first draft. The Bible says that ministers should be able to read a passage of Scripture and explain it to others.

articles.title: Shut Down Google's Waymo & All Autonomous Vehicles NOW! Rally At Waymo Depot In SF
articles.summary: Waymo autonomous taxis are owned by Google. Google gave $10 million to Governor Newsom in 2020. Google, Tesla and Cruise are allowed to run the DMV and California Public Utilities Commission CPUC. Elon Musk's Tesla is also requesting a license to start operating their autonomous vehicles statewide. Newsom has twice vetoed legislation by the California legislature to require trucks over 10,000 lbs. to have a driver.

articles.title: Successful animation adventure ‘The Wild Robot' playing for free at App Theatre Saturday
articles.author: JERRY SNOW
articles.summary: 'The Wild Robot' is playing for free at Appalachian Theatre of the High Country on Saturday, March 8 starting at 11 a.m. It's an artificial intelligence, computer animation adventure, survival, science-fiction film with three Oscar nominations. After a shipwreck, an intelligent robot called Roz is stranded on an uninhabited island.

articles.title: Presentation material( (SoftBank Group Corp)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: ASI will be within 10 years from SoftBank World 2024 Keynote Speech3AI ChipAIASIData centerAI RobotArtificial SuperIntelligence.45 Jan 21, 2025 in the U.S.   "Cristal".

articles.title: As Microsoft's Ready-Made AI Agents Work Their Way Into Big Businesses, Workers Fear Unemployment While Managers Fear Disaster
articles.author: Kyra Piperides
articles.summary: Microsoft has launched a new AI program called Copilot. It offers ten ready-made AI employees, designed to take on menial work tasks so that employees and managers can divert their attention elsewhere. Law firm Clifford Chance and UK retailer Pets At Home are clients of the program. Some people are concerned about the practicalities of hiring AI agents.

articles.title: Prediction: This Magnificent Artificial Intelligence (AI) Chip Stock Will Be Worth $2 Trillion in 5 Years
articles.author: Harsh Chauhan
articles.summary: TSMC stock has risen 69% in the past three years, bringing its market cap to $980 billion. The company fabricates chips for all the major chip designers, including Nvidia and AMD. It has a dominant 64% share of the global foundry market and is well-placed to make the most of the secular growth in the AI chip market over the long run.

articles.title: Spectacular AI Profitability? DeepSeek Claims Unbelievable 545% Margin
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek claims a theoretical profit margin of 545% for its AI models. The claim is sending ripples through the tech world, but it's not too good to be true.    "higher throughput and lower latency" is the key to profitability.

articles.title: Thread: Sexy AI
articles.summary: Elon is demoing GROK in Sexy Mode for Joe Rogan in the opening 5 minutes of this posdcast. He says that within 5 years there could be sex robots with AI like this. Simon43 should have been the Elon of the sex-doll world with his hands on experience and his primitive sex-chat AI prototype software business.

articles.title: World's largest call center using AI to 'neutralize' Indian employees' accents
articles.author: Mashable
articles.summary: Teleperformance SE, the largest call center operator on the planet, invested $13 million in Sanas, an AI startup. Sanas has created technology that focuses on "reducing accent-based discrimination" and can neutralize Indian and Filipino accents. Teleperformance will invest a further $104 million in AI.

articles.title: Reason: Omniscient AI? Hey, wait a minute!
articles.author: Mike Zimmer
articles.summary: Omniscience is the ability to know everything. This essay explores the idea of omniscience through a fictional device called the Omniscience Machine. The machine claims to be the ultimate intelligence augmenter, replacing all doubt and uncertainty with pure, absolute knowledge. It starts with human input and works its way up from there.

articles.title: Students' use of AI spells death knell for critical thinking
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: 92% of UK universities warned to'stress-test' assessments as 92% of students use AI. Traditional sources of knowledge have been challenged by developments in information presentation and retrieval. Curated reading lists, which academics spend time on researching, highlighting key thinkers and writings, are often overlooked by students in favour of a Google search.

articles.title: People With This Level of Education Use AI the Most at Work
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.summary: According to Pew Research Center, 63% of American workers don't use artificial intelligence much or at all in their jobs. However, 57% use AI for research, 52% edit written content, and 47% write drafts with chatbots. OpenAI admitted that even the most advanced AI models can't solve most software engineering issues.

articles.title: Nvidia's Risk-Reward Proposition Is Much Less Favorable, According to 1 Wall Street Analyst
articles.author: Bram Berkowitz
articles.summary: Summit Insights analyst is downgrading Nvidia from a buy to a hold with no price target listed. Kinngai Chan expects Nvidia to keep beating consensus estimates in future earnings reports, especially after strong fiscal 2025 fourth-quarter results, but he's concerned growth could decelerate into 2HFY26. The emergence of DeepSeek, a powerful AI chatbot that was supposedly built at a fraction of the cost of popular names like ChatGPT and more efficient AI training will adversely impact Nvidia on a long-term basis.

articles.title: SoftBank to borrow $16 billion for AI investment
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: SoftBank Group CEO Masayoshi Son plans to borrow $16 billion to invest in artificial intelligence (AI) according to The Information tech news website. The company's executives told banks last week that they want to borrow the money to do that, according to the website.

articles.title: China's Honor pledges $10 billion AI investment and deepens ties with Google in global push
articles.author: Arjun Kharpal
articles.summary: Honor has pledged $10 billion in artificial intelligence investments over the next five years and announced a deepening partnership with Google. The Chinese smartphone maker is trying to reposition itself as an "AI device ecosystem company" after spinning off from Huawei in 2020. Honor's smartphone market share outside of China stood at 2.3% in 2024 versus 1.7% in 2023, according to IDC.

articles.title: 'Material Defects': The Strange Mutations of Jeff Herrity
articles.author: Randy Shulman
articles.summary: Jeff Herrity studied at Corcoran School of Art at the age of 48. His current exhibit, 'Material Defects,' is on display at Transformer Gallery, 1404 P St. NW until March 8th. Hours are Wednesday through Saturday, noon to 6 p.m., or by appointment.

articles.title: Why Veritone, Inc. (VERI) is Plunging So Far in 2025
articles.author: Omor Ibne Ehsan
articles.summary: Veritone, Inc. (NASDAQ:VERI) is a tech company that specializes in AI. It has an aiWARE platform that can transform unstructured data to make them more digestible for its clients. Veritone is down 16.31% year-to-date and ranks 11th on our list of the AI stocks that are plunging so far in 2025.

articles.title: AI in workforce management
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming workforce management, revolutionising business operations and employee engagement. It uses predictive analytics, natural language processing, and machine learning to help organisations manage their workforce better.    i.e. to improve employee engagement and productivity.

articles.title: Weekly Tech Recap: OpenAI launches GPT 4.5, Claude gets Sonnet 3.7 update and more
articles.author: Live Mint
articles.summary: Meta plans to launch a standalone app for its AI. Anthropic has launched Claude app.    - TechCrunch's weekly tech recap.  - Mike Downey. - Michael Downey, Mike Schmitz, Mike Wojcicki.

articles.title: Top 5 Purchases for Middle-Class Wealth Building: Strategies for Financial Growth
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Archyde is diving deep into the world of AI-powered content creation for WordPress. Elena Rodriguez is the Head of Content strategy at 'ContentForge,' a leading digital marketing agency specializing in WordPress solutions. Elena believes that AI rewriting tools like ChatGPT and Google Gemini can be transformative, but with a caveat. Elena's advice on ethical and responsible use of these tools for WordPress is to research thoroughly and test multiple tools yourself.

articles.title: ‘There's still hope and joy to be had': Art adds colour to end-of-life hospice care
articles.author: Sunday Post
articles.summary: For Alison Couston, hope is as simple as a brush stroke. She hopes to be able to help others in the future.    for Alison C Houston's charity, Hope for All.  For more information, go to www.hopeforall.org.

articles.title: The TechCrunch AI glossary
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is a complex field with lots of moving pieces. The scientists who work in this field rely on jargon and lingo to explain what they're working on. We have put together a glossary with definitions of some of the most important words and phrases that we use in our articles.

articles.title: How Teachers Can Use AI Tools to Make Their Jobs Easier
articles.author: Teacher Misery
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming education in exciting ways. Teachers can leverage AI to make their jobs easier. They can save time on administrative tasks, personalize learning experiences, keep students engaged, and gain valuable insights to improve their teaching practices. AI has the potential to support students with disabilities and make education more inclusive for everyone.

articles.title: Carney's AI Gamble
articles.author: David Coletto
articles.summary: Mark Carney's promise to expand artificial intelligence in his economic plan may be a risky proposal. Canadians' views on artificial intelligence have been shifting more negative over time. More people believe AI will have a negative impact on society than a positive one. The gap has been growing.

articles.title: Wageningen Scientists Awarded Vici Grants: A Big Leap for Research Excellence
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Dr. Evelyn Reed is a bioethicist at the Institute for Digital Ethics and Animal Welfare. Her research focuses on the ethical implications of using digital technology to improve human-animal relationships. She hopes her research will contribute to a more compassionate and informed approach to animal care.

articles.title: Elon Musk's Grok 3 makes a bold move as AI market intensifies
articles.author: Samuel O'Brient
articles.summary: xAI is trying to stand out in the AI chatbot market with its Grok chatbot. The company recently launched the ability to converse over voice with the chatbot, including preset personalities such as 'romantic,''sexy' and 'unhinged'

articles.title: Distillation for AI Chatbots Is the New Buzzword That Could Change Everything
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence companies like OpenAI, Microsoft, and Meta are using a technique called distillation to make cheaper and more efficient AI models. Chinese startup DeepSeek used it to create powerful models based on open-source technology from Meta and Alibaba. The rise of distillation is good news for supporters of open AI models, but it also poses challenges for smaller, resourceful competitors.

articles.title: (Opinion) Lou Cartier: Emotional intelligence from a robot?
articles.author: Lou Cartier
articles.summary: Can the 'robot' truly emulate self-awareness, lived experience and lessons learned? Are decisions based on a kazillion data points and simulated emotional intelligence sufficient?Originally published on March 2, 2025 at 6:00 AM MST and updated on March 3, 2025.

articles.title: How to Use the AI Trip Planner on Booking.com
articles.author: Amanda Smith
articles.summary: Booking.com's AI Trip Planner is designed to be like having a travel agent at your fingertips. It can help with research, analyzing reviews and providing tailored trip suggestions. The planner launched in June 2023 and is available via the Booking mobile app. It's still in beta mode, so it's prone to mistakes.

articles.title: Sunday Good Reads for March 2nd, 2025

articles.author: Rebekah Koffler
articles.summary: At a recent artificial intelligence global summit, Chinese Vice Premier Zhang Guoqing encouraged other countries to embrace Chinese artificial intelligence technology in their domestic markets. The United States must not fall for yet another trick by China. The concept of "Unrestricted Warfare" underpins China's grand plan to become the dominant world power by 2049.

articles.title: Jersey police trial AI to transcribe interviews
articles.author: BBC
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being tested within the police to help transcribe witness interviews. Deputy chief officer Scott Hall confirmed the development of AI within the force during a Children, Education and Home Affairs scrutiny hearing. The technology is currently in trials and being developed in line with ethical guidelines.

articles.title: How IBM CEO Arvind Krishna Is Thinking About AI and Quantum Computing
articles.author: Billy Perrigo
articles.summary: IBM helped design the modern PC and created the first AI to defeat a human champion in the game of chess. IBM doesn't make consumer-facing products any more, but it does build AI models for use in high-stakes settings. IBM CEO Arvind Krishna was awarded a TIME100 AI Impact Award in February.

articles.title: Gridlock Guy: A.I. being tested to nab distracted drivers
articles.author: Doug Turnbull
articles.summary: Automated traffic cameras are being trialled in the U.S. and abroad. They detect distracted drivers and those without seatbelts. In Minnesota, live officers have to vet flagged images and then find the drivers and pull them over. Acusensus' policy is that photos not addressed by police are deleted in 15 minutes.

articles.title: The AI Revolution In Business: Insights From Kellogg Professor Sawhney
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Generative AI is revolutionizing industries, transforming digital marketing, business operations, and customer engagement. Let's get ready for this Ai-driven wave.   .     Â   in this article. For more information, visit Generative AI's website.

articles.title: Parents are worried about AI chatbots popping up in kids' apps. Experts say here's what to watch for.
articles.summary: Companies are rushing to add AI chat elements into their consumer apps and services aimed at kids and teens. Some parents are concerned about the social and emotional implications of using AI chatbots for kids. Industry watchers agree that chatbots are here to stay and parents should teach their kids how to use them safely.

articles.title: SoftBank Bets Big on AI With $16B Loan, But Can It Sustain the Risk?
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: SoftBank Group (SFTBY) plans to borrow $16 billion to invest in artificial intelligence (AI). This follows SoftBank's ongoing efforts to expand in AI, including talks to invest up to $25 billion in OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT. SoftBank has already committed $15 billion to Stargate, a joint venture with OpenAI and Oracle. The average price target for SFTBY stock is $32.20, implying a 16.37% upside potential.

articles.title: Parents are worried about AI chatbots popping up in kids' apps. Experts say here's what to watch for.
articles.summary: Companies are rushing to add AI chat elements into their consumer apps and services aimed at kids and teens. There's not a lot of research about how kids and chatbots interact. Chris's 10-year-old daughter accidentally used an AI chatbot on her iPad.

articles.summary: Companies are rushing to add AI chat elements into their consumer apps and services aimed at kids and teens. There's not a lot of research about how kids and chatbots interact. Chris's 10-year-old daughter had an alarming encounter with an AI chatbot and she deleted the app.

articles.title: AI courses are becoming increasingly popular — even among nurses and teachers
articles.author: system
articles.summary: The director of Carnegie Mellon's undergraduate degree in AI says the program stays flexible. Non-STEM students are more interested in AI than STEM students, he says, because large language models and generative AI have taken over the classroom and "sucked all the oxygen out of the room".

articles.title: That humanities degree might come in handy if you want a job in AI, the editorial director at Google's NotebookLM says
articles.summary: Steven Johnson co-founded several startups and worked as an author before becoming editorial director of NotebookLM at Google. He believes that a degree in the humanities might be useful in the field of AI. Amanda Askell, a philosopher who works as an alignment fine-tuning researcher for Anthropic, is an example of someone who does character training for AI models.

Consumers are educating themselves about greenwashing.

articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices is a supplier of graphics processing units (GPUs) used for artificial intelligence (AI) training. The company finished the fourth quarter on a strong note with revenue and adjusted earnings up 24% and 42% year over year. AMD expects 2025 to bring strong growth in its data center business. AMD's PC processors are selling well and it's well-positioned for continued momentum in the PC market. Dell announced it would offer a full lineup of commercial PCs powered by AMD's Ryzen processors for the first time.

articles.title: 2 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy Before They Soar
articles.author: John Ballard
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is a once-in-a-generation investment opportunity. C3.ai is the dark horse in the AI software market right now. Dell is a leader in servers. Its stock is up almost 400% over the last five years.

articles.author: Sarah Perkel
articles.summary: Universities are increasingly offering courses in artificial intelligence. Carnegie Mellon was one of the first to develop an undergraduate degree in AI, enrolling its inaugural class in 2018. Johns Hopkins is working to increase the "breadth and depth" of its AI courses.

articles.title: AI courses are becoming increasingly popular — even among nurses and teachers
articles.summary: Universities are increasingly offering courses in artificial intelligence. Carnegie Mellon was one of the first to develop an undergraduate degree in AI, enrolling its inaugural class in 2018. Johns Hopkins is offering more courses towards non-traditional backgrounds, including nursing, business, and education.

articles.title: Prediction: 2 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks That Will Be Worth More Than Palantir by 2026

articles.summary: Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) has benefited from the increase in AI spending and investor excitement. Palantir's revenues have increased 50% over the last two years, but the company's stock price has climbed more than tenfold in the same period. Qualcomm's chip business could see a big bump in the near future as tech companies embed more AI processing power and capabilities into PCs, smartphones, and other personal computing devices.

articles.title: Announcing the Groundbreaking 16th Edition of Business Communication Today by Bovee and Thill
articles.summary: Courtland Bovee and John Thill have released the 16th edition of Business Communication Today. It's the first business communication textbook to integrate artificial intelligence into every chapter. It offers practical guidance on leveraging AI tools for tasks such as business writing, creating presentations, conducting virtual meetings, managing social media, and enhancing visual communication.

articles.title: What's the down side of using algorithms to sell products and brands
articles.author: Lauren Labrecque
articles.summary: Research on artificial intelligence in marketing neglects its potential negative consequences, a new study finds. The study was published in the journal "Marketing Research". It is based on a survey of more than 1,000 research papers on marketing research on AI in marketing.

articles.title: AI misunderstands some people's words more than others
articles.author: Roberto Rey Agudo
articles.summary: Speaking with an AI bot can be amusing and helpful if it understands you. How well AIs do that is a matter of whose speech they've been trained on and how well they're taught to do it.    iReport.com will let you know how it goes.

Telecommunication companies such as AT&T and Verizon are natural customers and partners for AI vendors.

articles.title: 2 AI Chip Stocks to Buy in March
articles.author: John Ballard
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) promises to generate wealth-building returns for investors. Nvidia supplies graphics processing units (GPUs) used for playing video games, autonomous driving, and 3D animation. The data center market has sent the stock up 1,800% over the last five years. Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing makes the chips for Nvidia and many other chip companies.

articles.title: Google co-founder Sergey Brin tells employees: ‘Work 60 hours-a-week to win…but'

articles.summary: Sergey Brin wants employees working on Google's AI models to embrace 60-hour workweeks and daily office presence. The New York Times reports that Brin told the staff that Google can lead the industry in achieving AGI, a milestone where machines surpass human intelligence, if employees worked harder.

articles.title: Ever lied on your CV? Now recruiters are fighting back

The four building blocks were a mobile AI agent, an all-ecosystem file transfer, deepfake AI detection and a new suite of photography tools in the AIMAGE suite. articles.title: The AI Revolution In Business: Insights From Kellogg Professor Sawhney
articles.author: Taarini Kaur Dang
articles.summary: Generative AI is revolutionizing the way businesses operate. Professor Mohanbir Sawhney is an expert in digital marketing, artificial intelligence applications, and business innovation. He explains how businesses should adopt AI to maximize its potential and the challenges they face.

articles.title: The Unvarnished Truth About AI's Alleged Cognitive Decline
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: There are claims that AI and large language models (LLMs) suffer from cognitive decline. AI makers are rapidly progressing their generative AI models. New techniques and ways to optimize the underlying pattern-matching are a fast-moving realm of research and practice.

articles.title: AI and the Oscars: Will the Academy reward artificial intelligence-infused movies The Brutalist and Emilia Pér
articles.author: Irish Independent
articles.summary: ChatGPT came up with a good idea in a matter of seconds and wrote about it in a social media post. It was good, original and fleshed out. AI is better than humans at coming up with good ideas in seconds, so why should writers wait for months for an idea?

articles.title: ‘Angel of death' advises Air Force Academy cadets on coming conflict
articles.summary: Allison Black served in the Air Force for 32 years. She retired as a colonel and commander of the 1st Special Operations Wing. She worked as a survival, evasion, resistance and escape specialist and a SERE specialist. She flew 2,000 combat hours in AC-130H Spectre Gunship and U-28A Draco.

articles.title: The AI books in your libraries from authors that don't actually exist... and how to ...
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is rapidly changing the way that every level of humanity exists. It has seeped into multiple facets of media and entertainment, including digital books written by authors. It is possible that some of the ideas may be contributed by generative AI.

articles.title: Aman Gupta REACTS To Founders' Claim That Their Invention Predicts Cancer: 'Meri Zindagi Kharab Ho Jayegi'
articles.author: News18
articles.summary: Shark Tank India featured SugarStrings.ai, a company that claims to predict cancer and heart diseases using DNA tests.    SugarStringsai claims to be able to predict these diseases based on DNA tests and is based on a DNA test.

articles.title: ‘I want him to be prepared': why parents are teaching their gen Alpha kids to use AI
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: Jules White's son, James, 11, needs to learn how to prompt artificial intelligence (AI) chatbots to be successful. The Vanderbilt computer science professor's goal is not to make him a generative AI wizard, but to teach him useful skills.

articles.title: DeepSeek AI mania takes over China – from prescriptions to parenting and government work
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: Use of AI in all spheres of life is being backed by the authorities. There are mixed feelings about its use in the medical sector, however.      Â  .   for medical use of AI is still a controversial subject.

articles.title: A leap of faith: Founder of AI company had a vision to make a difference, ...
articles.author: Napa Valley Register
articles.summary: Rabie Zahri is the co-founder and CEO of Positon AI. His goal is to revolutionize the artificial intelligence industry. He took a leap of faith when he started his company and wants to change the industry with his AI technology.

articles.title: Samsung's Super Cheap Galaxy A-Series Smartphones Come With ‘Awesome Intelligence'
articles.author: Gizmodo
articles.summary: It's Samsung's way of rebranding artificial intelligence for the low-cost market. It's a way of repackaging it for the mass market.    for the cheap market. For more information, visit Samsung's official website here.

articles.title: Smartphone maker Honor bets on AI-powered 'intelligent phone'
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Honor is developing an AI-powered intelligent phone with a personal mobile AI agent that can perform tasks like making. The phone will be powered by an artificial intelligence agent called a 'persona intelligent agent' (persona AI agent) and will be able to make decisions.

articles.title: Inside the cut-throat world of ‘true-crime' TV news: ‘I'm scared s–tless'
articles.author: New York Post
articles.summary: Claire St. Amant produces true crime stories for CBS' '48 Hours' and '60 Minutes' She learned that the business is cutthroat and competitors like NBC's 'Dateline' and ABC's '20/20' would go to any length to get an exclusive.

articles.title: Microsoft launches native Mac app for Copilot
articles.author: Business Ghana
articles.summary: Microsoft is making its Copilot AI assistant available as a Mac app. It's rolling out today in the US, the UK and Canada. The app will offer access to the web-based version of the tool. In practice, the functionalities sound similar to the experience of visiting the web version.

articles.title: Intelmatix introduces ‘AI Academy' to empower organizations
articles.author: GCC Business News
articles.summary: Intelmatix, an artificial intelligence company headquartered in Riyadh and with offices in London and Boston, has launched 'AI Academy,' a pioneering AI training program. The initiative aims to provide organizations with a comprehensive and strategic understanding of AI, empowering them to successfully integrate AI into their business.

articles.title: Softbank in talks to borrow US$16 billion to fund AI
articles.author: Taipei Times
articles.summary: Softbank Group chief executive officer Masayoshi Son plans to borrow US$16 billion to invest in artificial intelligence. The Information tech news Web site reported on Saturday that this is according to people familiar with the matter. The Japanese company's executives told banks last week.

articles.title: Healthcare, business & AI: Nigeria's diagnostics revolution must start now
articles.author: Business Day Online
articles.summary: Globally, the healthcare AI market is projected to hit a staggering $102.7 billion by 2028, according to Fortune Business. Nigeria's business and AI revolution needs to start now.      .   i   in this article.

articles.title: Lenovo's ThinkBook Flip puts an extra-tall folding display on a laptop
articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: Lenovo is showing its ThinkBook 'codename Flip' AI PC Concept at Mobile World Congress. It's a productivity / business laptop with a flexible display that can be used as a traditional 13.1-inch clamshell or a folded-up laptop.

articles.title: OpenAI launching GPT-4.5, its next general-purpose large language model
articles.author: Ammon
articles.summary: OpenAI announced the research preview of GPT-4.5, a general-purpose large language model on Thursday. It's a research tool for developing AI programs. It will be available for general use within the next few years. It is available on GitHub.

articles.title: Financial chief vows to develop AI as key industry
articles.author: Hong Kong Standard
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence should be promoted as a key industry in Hong Kong, Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po said on Sunday. He encourages young people to engage in its development. Hong Kong must adapt to international changes through transformation and drive development with innovation, he added.

articles.title: The AI Revolution in Cross-Border Payments: Innovations and Future Trends
articles.author: International Business Times
articles.summary: The world of international finance is undergoing a significant transformation driven by artificial intelligence (AI). Traditional cross-border payments have long been plagued by inefficiencies and security concerns. AI is now streamlining these processes, making them faster and cost-effective. This article explores AI's role in this transformation.

articles.title: People With This Level of Education Use AI the Most at Work
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: 63% of American workers can't solve the majority of problems with artificial intelligence at work, according to a new Pew Research Center survey involving a demographically representative sample of more than 5,200 US workers. Many highly educated people use artificial intelligence in their work.

articles.title: The TechCrunch AI glossary
articles.author: Crunch
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is a deep and convoluted world. The scientists who work in this field often rely on jargon and lingo to explain it.    i   in the   of this article.  in this article, in which the author uses the  of the

articles.title: India's AI ecosystem has bright future, but challenges remain: Blume Ventures
articles.author: Deccan Herald
articles.summary: China has invested heavily in its AI ecosystem. China is the base for an eighth of the world's top AI researchers, while India has none. India's position in the AI field has been questioned recently.       - Blume's report.

articles.title: Parents are worried about AI chatbots popping up in kids' apps. Experts say here's what ...
articles.author: system
articles.summary: There is not a lot of research about how kids and chatbots interact. Some parents are concerned that kids might tend to overshare when using AI chat elements in kid-friendly apps and services, which some companies are rushing to add.    "When we give kids technology that's not designed for kids and it's designed for adults, there are real harms and the downsides can be severe"

articles.title: How AI-enhanced imaging technology helps better detect and treat breast cancer
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: Researchers from University of Waterloo have developed a new imaging technology that uses AI. It is based on AI technology developed by researchers from the university's research centre. It uses AI technology to create a 3D image using AI technology.      Â

articles.title: Humans will hold supervisory positions in the AI age
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: Growing talks around the use of agentic AI have sparked concerns about the technology's impact on hiring and the nature of work for human employees. Companies like Service Now and Hinduja Global Solutions say that AI will not take away jobs, but leaders agreed that AI agents can carry out lower level functions leaving the higher level ones to humans.

articles.title: DeepSeek reveals theoretical 545% margin
articles.author: Taipei Times
articles.summary: DeepSeek's theoretical profit margin could be more than five times the cost. The company has a cost profit margin of 545 percent and a theoretical profit of more than 5 times that.    in the Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) phenomenon DeepSeek.

articles.title: Google co-founder Sergey Brin tells employees: ‘Work 60 hours-a-week to win…but'
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Sergey Brin wants Google employees working on the company's AI models to work 60 hours a week and have a daily office presence to be more productive. The New York Times reports that Brin said this is the sweet spot of productivity.

articles.title: Catalysing human-AI synergy
articles.author: The Star
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming higher education with the next wave of innovations aiming to lessen workload, enhance learning analytics and deepen student engagement. Read the full story at: http://www.businessinsider.com/article/artificial-intelligence-is-transforming-higher-education-with-the-next wave-innovations-aiming-to-eliminate-workload, enhance-learning-analytics and deepen-student-engagement.

articles.title: Manateq developing electronic platform for ease of investors
articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: The Economic Zones Company, Manateq, is developing an electronic platform with an app and ChatBot using Artificial Intelligence (AI) which is expected to be announced this year. One of their goals in 2025 is to announce a platform for investors and an app.

articles.title: Exclusive: Honor Debuts a New AI Agent That Can Read and Understand Your Screen
articles.author: Wired
articles.summary: The Honor UI Agent is powered by Google's Gemini 2 model. It gives us a glimpse of artificial intelligent agents on Android. It is available now on Google Play Store.      Â   for $99.99 with Google Play Services.

articles.title: Cover Story: DeepSeek Sets Up Race for Chinese Dominance in AI
articles.author: Caixin Online
articles.summary: DeepSeek has shaken up the global tech industry following the Lunar New Year. It has ignited fierce competition in artificial intelligence (AI) from computing power to applications, applications, large language models, cloud services and AI-related services.  .

articles.title: Unveiling OpenAI's Startup Empire: Revolutionary AI Investments Fueling the Future
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: OpenAI's influence extends deeply into the startup ecosystem through its dedicated OpenAI Startup Fund. This initiative isn't just about funding but about shaping the future of AI and venture capital in the world of artificial intelligence and startups. It's a venture capitalist's dream come true.

articles.title: ‘The next generation of AI will be speech-based'
articles.author: Ekathimerini
articles.summary: Maja Pantic is special AI adviser to Neom, dean of computing at the future Neom University and professor of AI at Imperial College London. She is in Athens for the EmTech Europe conference. She believes that artificial intelligence should be a legacy for the whole human race.

articles.title: Data hub goal for AI institute
articles.author: Hong Kong Standard
articles.summary: Sun Dong hopes the new AI Research and Development Institute will help turn Hong Kong into a "data hub". Sun believes that artificial intelligence will reshape human life and drive high-quality development in the future. The SAR government is determined to implement measures in AI despite financial challenges.
